scenario:
A new report from Escalent finds that business customer engagement with utilities has improved significantly, ending a trending decline that began at the end of 2021. The Engaged Customer Relationship (ECR) score, which measures business customer engagement, has increased from 766 in 2023 to 784 in 2024. The score is composed of ratings across service satisfaction, brand and product experiences. 

The improvement in ECR scores is attributed to a significant Brand Trust gain, with improved scoring related to utility company reputation and business community support leading the index gain. Utilities that develop focused programs, customer service options, and communication for small and midsize business customers see higher engagement scores. 

The 2024 Business Customer Champions, 24 utilities that have ECR scores well above their industry peers, are performing remarkably well with smaller business customers. These utilities outperform the industry for the perception among business customers with less than $500K in revenue that utility programs help customers save money and energy. 

The 2024 Business Customer Champions include AEP Ohio, Louisville Gas & Electric, AES Indiana, and 20 other utilities. The report is based on surveys among 12,308 business customers of 78 US electric, natural gas, and combination utility companies. 

The ECR Index scores for the 78 utilities surveyed are as follows: East Region (average score 784), Midwest Region (average score 785), Southern Region (average score 816), and West Region (average score 794). The Natural Gas Utilities Customer Engagement Performance average score is 805. 

The report highlights the importance of developing focused programs, customer service options, and communication for small and midsize business customers to improve engagement scores. Utilities that prioritize these efforts are more likely to see higher engagement scores and improved customer satisfaction.
